meanings.sent1: After the chaos, they had to renormalize their daily routine.
meanings.sent2: It is important to renormalize the temperature of the room for comfort.
meanings.sent3: Trying to renormalize a messy room is like trying to solve a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to renormalize her life after the unexpected changes.
meanings.sent5: The therapist helped him renormalize his thoughts and emotions.

meanings.definition: Adjust or modify to bring back to a normal state.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to renormalize the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to renormalize sleeping patterns after traveling.
meanings.sent3: He tried to renormalize his hairstyle after a gust of wind messed it up.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to renormalize the colors in the painting to match the original vision.
meanings.sent5: She needed to renormalize her budget after overspending last month.
